content: I'm going to try reaching out to Andrew Kelley about potentially having a CTCFT section about Zig/Rust in March. Does anyone have any connections to him, and could maybe do an introduction? Otherwise, I'll just send an email and CC @nikomatsakis and @Josh Triplett I think.

Also, what topics would be a good prompt for this talk? This Tweet prompted the idea, but I'm sure there is more overlap that Rust teams would care about.

I'm curious if any Rust folks are interested in this - this work is extremely reusable and it's really not that much code to add to the compiler to parse this 165 KB file and then be able to cross compile for any glibc version on any CPU architecture. https://twitter.com/andy_kelley/status/1470332120665001990

- Andrew Kelley (@andy_kelley)
I do want to hear about that, and I would love to use that work.
I would also be interested in Rust async and Zig async; there are fundamental design differences there.
Also, any "what I would have done differently with Zig in hindsight" ideas, especially "and can't now because that would break things".
Things he most likes about Rust; things he least likes about Rust.
Experiences with "zig cc", good and bad, with an eye towards us making "rustc file.rs otherfile.c" work.
In particular, how their equivalent of bindgen works.

I think it'd be nice to hear from Zig-- I'd also like to be thinking about Rust-focused topics-- I would enjoy another round of "Rust organizational things", I was going to suggest March as a good spot for that theme, but maybe April would be better?
